reviewText: just one funny movie I worked for the railroad for many years but I if I did some of the things which were done in the movies they would have buried me long ago. Really though it was a well done movie and enjoyable to watch great for the whole family.
A marvelous comedian, one of a kind, in an interesting film. Writing and directing were his other talents.
Unbelievably bad job of colorizing and musical accompaniment!!!

In THE GENERAL, Buster Keaton portrays a loyal Southerner during the Civil War who is also engineer of the entitled steam locomotive. When Union soldiers make off with his beloved engine, Keaton pursues them in a second and eventually manages to steal the General back. The plot is a set-up for two superb train chase sequences that climax with one's plunge into a river after a wooden bridge the train is crossing collapses. Re-creation of Civil War uniforms and equipage is remarkably accurate, the Tennessee and Georgia scenery (which is really rural Oregon) looks perfect. Keaton's effortless and amazing stunt abilities make this a most unforgettable film-- a classic in every sense of the word and a must-see for all! Also recommended: For one low price, the BEST OF BUSTER KEATON (from Canadian outfit St. Clair) includes "The General," a handful of other Keaton sound features and several of his finest comedy shorts. Parenthetical number preceding title is a 1 to 10 imdb viewer poll rating. (8.3) The General (silent-1926) - Buster Keaton/Marion Mack/Frederick Vroom/Joe Keaton/Glen Cavender (uncredited: Al St. John)

The item was in excellent condition. The shipping was in a timely manner.
The silent movie was enjoyed by my son and his wife and my wife and I.
Thank you.
The DVD was good.  Delta's print seems pretty clean but is this the complete, unedited version of The General?
